title: Password reset token leakage
content:
Reset Password link : http://hackers.upchieve.org/setpassword?token=a3c448b1eb9b982f93ec39a7181ec1a2
1.Open Password reset page from email.
2.Intercept the request(I have used burp suite)
3.You can see the link for reset password in below requests
POST /j/collect?v=1&_v=j93&a=1038273919&t=pageview&_s=1&dl=https%3A%2F%2Fhackers.upchieve.org%2Fsetpassword%3Ftoken%3Da3c448b1eb9b982f93ec39a7181ec1a2&dp=%2Fsetpassword&ul=en-us&de=UTF-8&dt=UPchieve&sd=24-bit&sr=1366x768&vp=1366x657&je=0&_u=wCCAAUABAAAAAC~&jid=185704536&gjid=1537782490&cid=83313712.1632910097&tid=UA-133171872-1&_gid=1095396647.1632910097&_r=1>m=2ou9r0&z=1390812166 HTTP/2

Impact
Misconfiguration
steps: Open the password reset page from the email.
Intercept the request using a tool like Burp Suite to observe the password reset link in the request.
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves the leakage of a password reset token through a request intercepted by a tool like Burp Suite. The token is exposed in a POST request to Google Analytics, which could allow an attacker to reset the user's password without authorization.
reason: The attack is straightforward and involves a single component (intercepting the request) without any complex interactions or state manipulations. The exposure of the token in a request to a third-party service is a common misconfiguration.
